Table of Contents

Name

henyey - search for periodic orbits in a potential (Henyey’s method)

Synopsis

henyey [parameter=value]

Description

henyey computes periodic orbits using the Henyey method of searching for periodic solutions of a system of differential equations in an (optionally rotating) 2D potential.

The method has been used first by T.S. v. Albada & R.H. Sanders (1982) MNRAS, 201, 303. For more details see also: Henyey et al.(1964) ApJ 139, 309

The method originated from the same equations as looking for solutions of pulsation stars (RR Lyr, Cepheids). See e.g. van Albada and Baker (1971)

Parameters
